frameDefinitions: An Entity undergoes some change (the Event) that is (or is construed as) punctual.
Individuals first encounter each other and make introductions at a particular Time, Place, or Context.
A Sleeper transitions from a state of consciousness where they are largely unaware of their environment to a wakeful state.
These words refer to Parts merging to form a Whole.
In this frame a group of Individuals meet to form a Configuration.
frameExamples: This <t>happens</t> to me all the time.
Impressed when he first <t>met</t> Nixon, he had always thought of him as an intelligent man, and believed that Nixon would take a stand for civil rights
The two droplets <t>merge</t>, and then travel down the windowpane even faster.
The crowd <t>came together</t> in the courtyard.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the event which occurs and affects the <fen>Entity</fen>.
This role identifies the entity, concrete or abstract.
This role identifies the time when the event occurs.
This role identifies where the event takes place.
The persons (or in rare cases animals) that make each other's acquaintance.
The semantically more prominent one of the two parties when the Individuals are realized separately.
The semantically less prominent of the two parties when the <fen>Individuals</fen> are expressed separately.
The time when the Individuals make each other's acquaintance.
The location where the Individuals make each others acquaintance.
This role identifies the sleeping entity.
This describes the state out of which the <fen>Sleeper</fen> awakens.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The entities that merge to form a single <fen>Whole</fen>.
The single, undifferentiated entity that is the result of the amalgamation.
The prominent entity that combines with <fen>Part_2</fen> to form a <fen>Whole</fen>.
The less focussed-upon entity that the <fen>Part_1</fen> merges with.
The time at which the <fen>Parts</fen> become amalgamated into a <fen>Whole</fen>
The location at which the amalgamation occurs.
The <fen>Individuals</fen> are self-movers who come together.
The <fen>Configuration</fen> describes the resulting formation of the individuals.
<fen>Party_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in the congregating event.
A grammatically less prominent participant in the congregating event.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the congregating occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the congregating occurs.
The event that elicits a <fen>Response</fen>.
The means action or judgement in response to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.
The point in time when <fen>Response</fen> is made to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Response</fen> action takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>My wife and I</fex> met in college working in the theatre and we will have been married for 30 years in June 2000.
<fex>Melissa Hurley</fex> had never met her neighbor, Richard Congdon ? the dog owner ? until recently, when she and a reporter knocked on his door.
Gossip reports say she either met <fex>Kennedy</fex> while helping him shop for suits at Calvin Klein, or was contacted by him after he saw her jogging in a New York park
I met my wife <fex>2 yrs ago</fex>.
Bill met his  wife <fex>in Poltava, Ukraine</fex>.
He awoke <fex>out of a deep dream</fex>.
They had all just merged <fex>into one big file</fex>.
<fex>The single smaller soul</fex> merges with the Ur-soul.
The single smaller soul merges <fex>with the Ur-soul</fex>.
<fex>The crowd</fex> gathered on the streets of Paris.
<fex>Our group</fex> met with theirs in the plaza.
Our group met <fex>with theirs</fex> in the plaza.
